intro: Loxospermum schimperi, commonly known as the Ethiopian ironweed, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, showing adaptability to arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, often covered with fine hairs, while the flowers are small and clustered in dense heads. Loxospermum schimperi is also noted for its medicinal properties, used traditionally in local remedies.
